Articles.Content:
@sumunisto KSP has serious problems with large pretty textures at the moment. Being a 32bit program KSP can only run with a limited amount of memory (something like 3.4gb of ram). Since the game loads all assets into memory on launch large textures eat into this very quickly. Everybody's computers spec's are unfortunately irrelevant to this problem. It gets worse with other mods that use textures. Sorry but your going to have to make a choice between high resolution textures and parts mods. Try removing textures your not likely to care about and/or parts you dont use very often. The trick is to find a balance that allows KSP to run without fps drops or crashes.
I am aware of the memory limitations of KSP mate, however this is not the case.No crashes occur and KSP does not pass the threshold of 3.34 Gb.I stated that I have removed all textures and tried running KSP with just skybox, but to no avail.I am unconvinced loading up RAM memory can in any way affect FPS of the game. Especifically when you get issues like increased FPS drops when holding a part.P.S.: Which forum admin had the clever idea of removing new lines. It just blows my mind away, the "brilliant mind" behind it...

Heres is the dres retexture

http://www./download/0m734hori9z672c/Dres_retexture.rar

Hello all! ZodiaK here! (awesome mod BTW) I was wondering if anyone could be kind enough to make me a suit texture.

I'd do it myself, but frankly, I'm utter rubbish.

here's a redering in paint:

Thanks!

ZodiaK. Yes, I know I said this before, but no-one seemed to notice

I don't get any perceivable FPS drop from new skyboxes, part count is the major limiting factor for me. Given that 99% of people will have a minimum of 2GB RAM, I'd imagine that CPU is the most important part of a spec for KSP in its current form. The RAM factor can be managed - I have 2GB and run just about 1GB worth of mods (size of gamedaa folder, minus size of gamedata/Squad), I very rarely experience RAM related crashes, but one more mod over my current level puts me in crashville. Other than that it runs smooth as silk, with the framerate dropping as part no. goes up. Recently I was docking a 300 part spaceplane with a modest spacestation and that was about the limit of barability. Given that my CPU and graphics card (Core i3 and nVidia GTS 250) are fairly middle-of-the-road its unsurprising, I'd wager a faster CPU would give me greatest benefit.

I am aware of the memory limitations of KSP mate, however this is not the case.No crashes occur and KSP does not pass the threshold of 3.34 Gb.I stated that I have removed all textures and tried running KSP with just skybox, but to no avail.I am unconvinced loading up RAM memory can in any way affect FPS of the game. Especifically when you get issues like increased FPS drops when holding a part.P.S.: Which forum admin had the clever idea of removing new lines. It just blows my mind away, the "brilliant mind" behind it...

Have you tried a fresh install?

I can't find it in the thread or on reddit, could someone post the link to the light brown version of eve please?

Oh, and I got the .rar you posted on reddit tingle, thanks a million!

@Zodiak: I'll give the suit a whirl. Just got a custom one for myself done, and wouldn't mind the practice. What color is the helmet, though? The image doesn't really help me! Also, the "hat" thing (not the helmet, but on his head, I don't know what that is called...) I don't think comes with the suit. I think that would be the kerbal texture itself, which I haven't messed with yet. It'll be a few days maybe, but I'll post up a link for you later!

UPDATE: I didn't want to double post, so here's the link to the suit - http://cl.ly/0W1L1J0B2v2w Was quicker than I thought! Worked out really well, IMO.

- for you german users if you're interested, I was a guest on Selgalds "Talkrakete", talking about the mod, ksp and me. Check it out if anyone is interested. It's a 4 part, with part 1 and 2 out as of when I'm writing this, I added it to the first post under reviews.
Spacex34, did you ever do a texture for the Mun? It's not in your pack anywhere even though you have a folder for it.

@ZodiaK Here's an updated version: http://cl.ly/3z2g1N0w3J0K

This, as it is set up, will randomized between 3 different helments. The black with white stripes (original one), an all white, and a white with black stripes. Whichever one you like, you can erase the others and name your favorite "Head1.png". Enjoy!

I think there may be a memory leak somewhere in the plugin, as no matter what texture I load, or even if I load one at all, the game sputters to around 30 FPS. This may have been reported before, but I don't have the patience to look though 35 pages of posts. (I have it set up so I get 40 posts per page, not 10)
It has been, by me, I don't know if more are experiencing it and just not noticing because their game usually runs lower than 60. It absolutely butchers fps even on a fresh install.

@Raptor831

Thank you so much!

ZodiaK. thanks for the alterations

[edit] nevermind, I finally found the page

I'm having trouble with the randomized suits. It chooses a new suit every time a new Kerbal EVAs and the suits don't match the helmets.

I'm having trouble with the randomized suits. It chooses a new suit every time a new Kerbal EVAs and the suits don't match the helmets.

I have a feeling that cannot be avoided for the time being. Suits are assigned at random, and they aren't permanent once the Kerbal has left the vessel. It could change again if another Kerbal leaves the vessel close by. At least that is my experience.
